intro: Hymenatherum neomexicanum, commonly known as the New Mexico glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, winged fruits that disperse its seeds by wind, aiding in its propagation. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Hymenatherum neomexicanum is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
